alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 7:37PM EST until January 15 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 to 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Windham County in Southern Vermont, The Glens Falls and Saratoga Region, central and eastern Mohawk Valley and the Helderbergs of eastern New York. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to noon EST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Travel could be very difficult Sunday night into Monday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
